data.enText: a ruler for measuring one yard

data.chText: （好坏或成败的）衡量标准；准绳
data.enText: a standard used for judging how good or successful sth is
a yardstick by which to measure sth

data.chText: 考试结果不是衡量学校水平的唯一标准。
data.enText: Exam results are not the only yardstick of a school's performance.

tr: a ruler or tape that is three feet long
a measure or standard used for comparison
example: on what kind of yardstick is he basing his judgment?

value.def: If you use someone or something as a yardstick, you use them as a standard for comparison when you are judging other people or things.

example.ex: There has been no yardstick by which potential students can assess individual schools before signing up for a course.
example.tran: 有意就读的学生在报名参加一门课程前没有任何参照标准去衡量各个学校的水平。

example.ex: She had never had a real boyfriend before and so had no yardstick by which to compare Charles's behaviour...
example.tran: 她以前从没有过真正的男朋友，所以没有可参照的标准来对比查尔斯的行为。

value.tran: 衡量标准；评判尺度；准绳
